title: Why aren't Children's Chinese Cartoons like this anymore?

embed.description: © Yoshihiro Togashi 1990-1994 "Yu Yu Hakusho"/comics originally serialized in the WEEKLY SHONEN JUMP published by Shueisha Inc. TV animation series "Yu Yu Hakusho" is produced by © Pierrot/Shueisha. Licensed by FUNimation® Productions, Ltd. All Rights Reserved.

body:
Youtube recommended that to me for some reason, and it was a quality TV show from the early 2000s somewhere.

This was a good show. The modern Children's Chinese Cartoons would take the cat girl that appeared for 10 seconds, turn her into a 4 year old without changing her outfit, and make a show about how she goes to school and flirts with teachers.
This quality show focuses on the two battlers who shoot beams of light at one another and transform into dragons and shoot lightning to kill each other. 

Why do they produce Children's Chinese Cartoons these days, instead of edgy anime tv shows?
